chapterTitle: Some Lessons From Capital Market History

columns.text: In this problem, we have to find the total real return on the investment in bonds given the rate of inflation.

The **total return on investment** is calculated as the year-on-year changes in the market value of investments or the recurring payments throughout the year. It is also known as the **nominal rate of return**.

In the case of equity, the total returns are in the form of **dividend** payments and capital gains over the year. In the case of bonds, such returns consist of **interest payments**.

However, this total rate of return on investment does not take into account the rate of inflation. When the total rate of return is adjusted for inflation, it is known as the **real rate of return on investment**.

The total return on investment rate (nominal rate) is calculated by using the following formula:

$$\text{Total Return on investment rate}=\frac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Amount Invested}}\times 100$$

The Net Income in the above formula will be the net cash inflows i.e. the difference between the cash inflow and the cash outflow.

The real rate of return on investment is calculated by using the following formula:

$$\text{Real Return on investment rate}=\frac{\text{1+Nominal Rate}}{\text{1+Inflation rate}}-1$$

We can observe that we have taken into account the inflation rate.

The following characteristics of the Great White Shark Repellant's bond are given:


|**Characteristic** |**Amount**| 
|--|--| 
|Bond Price a year ago |\$1,030 | 
|Coupon Rate | 5.8%| 
|Time to maturity from today | 14 years| 
|Required Return on investment | 5.1%| 

The inflation rate is $3.9\%$

Let us first determine the price of the bond today. For this, we will need a financial calculator. The instructions regarding what to enter are written below:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{N}&=14\\
1/y&=5.1\\
\text{FV}&=\$1,000\\
\text{PMT}&=5.8
\end{aligned}$$

After this press $\text{CPT}$ and then $\text{PV}$. The answer will be $\$1,068.849558$.

Thus, the approximate value of the bond today is $\$1,068.85$.

Now we will calculate the total return on investment $(r_n)$ by using the formula in step 3. 

But first, we will require the net inflows at present. If we sell the bond we will get $\$1,068.85$. 

Also, there will be interest income at $5.8\%$ on the face value of $\$1,000$. The interest is calculated in the following manner:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Interest}&=5.8\% \times \$1,000\\
&=\frac{5.8}{100} \times \$1,000\\\\
&=\$58
\end{aligned}$$

Thus we have the interest income till now i.e. $\$58$.

We know that total returns amount to the sum of the selling price of the bond and the interest income. The net inflows will be the difference between the total returns and the purchase price of the bond $(\$1,030)$. Accordingly,  
$$\begin{aligned}
r_n&=\frac{\$1,068.85+\$58-\$1,030}{\$1,030}\times 100\\\\
&=\frac{\$96.85}{\$1,030}\times100\\\\
&\approx0.094\times100\\
&=9.4\%
\end{aligned}$$

Thus the total return on investment or the nominal rate of investment is $9.4\%$

We will use the formula in step 4 to calculate the real rate of return on investment $(r_r)$:

$$\begin{aligned}
r_r&=\frac{\text{1+0.094}}{\text{1+0.039}}-1\\\\
&=\frac{\text{1.094}}{\text{1.039}}-1\\\\
&=1.052935-1\\
&=0.052935\\
\end{aligned}$$
 Thus the real rate of return on investment is $5.293\%$ or approximately $5.3\%$
Therefore, it can be concluded that when the inflation rate over the past year was $3.9\%$ the real rate of return on the bond of the Great White Shark Repellant is $5.3\%$
